current_medications.description: List all medications you are currently taking

medications.name: Albuterol
medications.purpose: Open airways for better mucus clearance

medications.name: Azithromycin
medications.frequency: Three times per week (Mon, Wed, Fri)

allergies.description: List any known allergies (medications, food, environmental)
food_allergies: Tree nuts - anaphylaxis risk, carries EpiPen

current_symptoms.description: Describe any symptoms you are currently experiencing

respiratory_symptoms.shortness_of_breath: Moderate dyspnea with exertion, can walk about half a mile before needing rest
respiratory_symptoms.coughing: Daily productive cough, worse in mornings. Requires 30-45 minutes of airway clearance each morning.
respiratory_symptoms.chest_tightness: Occasional chest tightness, usually relieved by airway clearance
respiratory_symptoms.sputum_production: Large amounts daily, approximately 3-4 tablespoons. Color varies from clear to yellow-green. Tracks color and consistency in journal.

general_symptoms.fatigue: Moderate fatigue, worse during infection flare-ups
general_symptoms.fever: No current fever, last fever 3 months ago during exacerbation
general_symptoms.sleep_quality: Moderate - wakes once or twice to cough, uses extra pillow

pain_assessment.description: Rate your pain levels and describe location

chest_pain.frequency: Daily, especially during prolonged coughing episodes
chest_pain.triggers: Airway clearance therapy, severe coughing fits

other_pain.description: Muscle soreness from coughing and chest physiotherapy

functional_status.description: Rate your ability to perform daily activities
functional_status.walking_distance: Can walk half a mile before moderate dyspnea
functional_status.stair_climbing: Can climb 2 flights with one rest break
functional_status.self_care_activities: Independent with all activities, though morning routine takes 2 hours due to treatments
functional_status.work_status: Working part-time as graphic designer from home, flexible schedule accommodates treatment needs
functional_status.exercise_tolerance: Does gentle yoga 3 times per week, walking 20-30 minutes daily

quality_of_life.description: Rate how your condition affects your daily life
quality_of_life.physical_limitations: Moderate - avoids strenuous activities, plans activities around treatment schedule
quality_of_life.emotional_wellbeing: Generally good with occasional anxiety during exacerbations. Participates in online support group.
quality_of_life.social_activities: Somewhat limited - avoids large crowds during flu season, selective about social events
quality_of_life.sleep_quality: Fair - generally gets 6-7 hours with occasional interruptions

environmental_exposures.description: Note any environmental factors affecting your health
environmental_exposures.occupational_exposures: Works from home, no significant exposures. Previously worked in office environment.
environmental_exposures.home_environment: Single-family home, replaced carpets with hardwood. HEPA air filters in bedroom and office. Regular HVAC maintenance.
environmental_exposures.air_quality_concerns: Monitors air quality daily, stays indoors during poor air quality. Lives near coast, benefits from ocean air.
environmental_exposures.recent_travel: Traveled to Seattle 2 months ago, brought portable nebulizer

compliance.description: How well are you following your treatment plan
compliance.medication_adherence: 90% compliant - maintains detailed medication log. Occasionally misses evening nebulizer when traveling.
compliance.pulmonary_rehabilitation: Completed program 1 year ago, continues home exercise program
compliance.dietary_restrictions: Follows anti-inflammatory diet, high protein intake. Avoids dairy during exacerbations.

recent_hospitalizations.treatment: IV tobramycin and ceftazidime, chest physiotherapy

recent_procedures.result: Bronchiectasis stable compared to previous, predominantly in lower lobes and lingula
FEV1 68% predicted, mild obstruction, slight improvement from prior
Normal respiratory flora, no growth of pathogenic organisms

upcoming_appointments.purpose: Routine monitoring and review of recent CT results
Review and optimize airway clearance techniques

additional_notes.patient_concerns: Concerned about increasing frequency of exacerbations (3 in past year vs 1-2 previously). Worried about antibiotic resistance. Wants to discuss preventive strategies. Planning pregnancy in next 1-2 years and has questions about disease management during pregnancy.
additional_notes.goals_for_visit: Reduce exacerbation frequency, optimize airway clearance regimen, discuss pregnancy planning with bronchiectasis
questions_for_doctor: Are there any new treatments available that could reduce my exacerbations?
Should I consider changing my prophylactic antibiotic?
What additional preventive measures can I take?
How should I manage my condition if I become pregnant?
Should I get vaccinated for RSV or other respiratory viruses?
Is there a specialist in bronchiectasis and pregnancy I could consult?
Should I increase the frequency of my nebulizer treatments?
